article.headline: Georgetown 63, Rutgers 57
article.story: WASHINGTON (AP)-- Brandon Bowman had 20 points and nine rebounds to lead unbeaten Georgetown to a 63-57 victory over Rutgers in the teams' Big East Conference opener Saturday. Darrel Owens scored 14 points and Courtland Freeman added 11 as the Hoyas improved to 10-0. Bowman also had four blocks and three steals. Quincy Douby scored six straight points to pull Rutgers to 59-57 on a driving layup with 2:59 remaining. The Scarlet Knights had two chances to tie or take the lead but Herve Lamizana was tied up by Gerald Riley and had his shot blocked by Owens on consecutive possessions. Ashanti Cook and Bowman both made two free throws in the final 17 seconds to secure the victory for the Hoyas (10-0, 1-0). Douby finished with 14 points on 7-for-13 shooting to lead Rutgers (7-3, 0-1). Adrian Hill added 12 points and nine rebounds. Calvin Wooten also scored 12, and Ricky Shields had 10 rebounds for the Scarlet Knights. After Sean Axani's post-up move pulled Rutgers to 52-47 with 7:58 left, Owens answered with a 3-pointer for the Hoyas. Owens had six points, including a dunk off his own steal, in Georgetown's 11-0 run to a 21-7 lead midway through the first half. The highlight of the period was Owen's backdoor baseline alley-oop slam from Matt Causey that gave Georgetown a 31-17 lead with 6:23 left. Bowman scored four points in the Hoyas' 6-0 run to a 29-13 lead.<
